text: <@U0PB67X4K> <@U0KN2SSKE> <@U0UGH3X7X> <@U0XPR4NP4> <@U0ULK2JPP> <@U0S5KF44D>  I am trying to reason through bootstrap from the perspective of getting the peer engine reworked for the  next arch.  I have posted a diagram that just begins to scratch the surface wrt to multi-channel support implications to boostrap.  It is attached to <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-426>
Thanks <@U0UKTPMG8> … as I work on the the simple end-to-end flow using the SOLO orderer (<https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-437>) trying to stay orthogonal to these bootstrapping issues
for instance, there’s the “GetLedger()” call in kv_ledgers.go that has warnings that this is severely temporary as subledgers (and related concepts) are being worked out

I'm looking into a way to dynamically change the log levels for different components of the fabric on a peer. This should be extremely useful for debugging and problem determination. My current prototype lets an administrator set the log level for any specific logger using command line with the following command: peer logging setlevel <component> <loglevel> . I also have a getlevel command which shows the current log level for a given component logger: peer logging getlevel <component>
Just throwing this out there to get feedback/suggestions from anyone else who may be interested in this functionality.
